org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudfoundry.application.deployment

Class Deployment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudfoundry.application.deployment.Deployment

  • public class Deployment
extends java.lang.Object
    this class provides methods to create the deployment script

      • treatServices

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> treatServices(java.util.List<java.lang.String> alreadyHandledServices)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        look for suitable services which match to the requirements of the user
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • configureSql

        public void configureSql(java.lang.String relativePathToSQLConfigureFile)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        will add a python script which executes the given sql file to the database. Only works with a mysql service and a .sql file
        Parameters:
        relativePathToSQLConfigureFile - must be the relative path started from the output/scripts folder to the .sql file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • executeFile

        public void executeFile(java.lang.String appName,
                        java.lang.String pathToFileOnContainer)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        will add a python script which executes a file on the warden container
        Parameters:
        appName - name of the created app
        pathToFileOnContainer - must be the path on the warden container. Probably something like that: "/home/vcap/app..."
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readCredentials

        public void readCredentials(java.lang.String appName,
                            java.lang.String serviceName,
                            ServiceTypes serviceType,
                            java.lang.String serviceInstanceName)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        will add a python script which read out the credentials of a service and write it to environment variables of the container
        Parameters:
        appName - name of the created app
        serviceName - must be the service name of the provider not the service instance name
        serviceType - e.g. "mysql" for a mysql service
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • replaceStrings

        public void replaceStrings(java.lang.String pathToLocalFile,
                           java.lang.String findStr,
                           java.lang.String replaceStr)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        will add a python script which replaces all occurrence of a string inside a file.
        Parameters:
        pathToLocalFile - must be the relative path started from the output/scripts folder to the file
        findStr - String which will be replaced
        replaceStr - String which replaces the findStr
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
